article:
I was planning to travel to Newcastle to visit  s and I arrived in London to get my plane transfer north to Newcastle. Unfortunately it had been   _  due to bad weather.
The airline was   _  -- offering me a choice between a night in a hotel or a six-hour bus ride to my   _  .
With no  _  as to whether a flight to
Newcastle would happen in the next two days, I chose the bus ride.
I stored all my baggage in the luggage compartment of the bus, thinking I would not need anything on the   _  .
The young lady sitting beside me could see how   _  I was and kindly
asked me if anyone would be  _  me on
my arrival.
Then I   _  that I had left my cell phone in my bag and had no way to contact my
 s. They would be waiting for me at the  _  about five hours before the bus got to Newcastle, not knowing what
had happened. Without  _  , the young lady
offered me the use of her cell phone.
When the bus made a rest stop, she asked me if I was   getting out  . I replied
that I wouldn't as I still had sandals on, and bare feet weren't be ideal for the cold weather. When she got back on, she'd bought me some tea and a packet of sweets to eat.
When we   _  arrived in Newcastle, the woman  _  that someone was there to meet me. I asked her to wait a moment while
I got my  _  to repay her, but when I
looked up she had gone. I was  _  to
even thank her.
